moderate.template:
Visual Requirements:
üö´ Please avoid including text, words, or written elements in illustrations.
The app will display story text separately below each image.
Focus on visual storytelling through imagery, expressions, and actions.

beginner.template: Use simple, concrete words and short sentences. Repeat key words. Avoid complex tenses.

intermediate.template: Use a mix of familiar and new vocabulary. Include some compound sentences. Introduce metaphors sparingly.

advanced.template: Use rich vocabulary including some challenging words (with context clues). Vary sentence structure. Include figurative language.

beginner.template: Create a linear story with clear cause-and-effect. Use repetitive patterns. Include simple emotional reactions.

intermediate.template: Include minor subplots. Show character motivations. Include problem-solving sequences. Balance action and reflection.

advanced.template: Develop multiple story layers. Include character growth. Explore complex emotions. Use foreshadowing.

enhancedVocabulary.template:
Include {targetWords} new vocabulary words that are slightly above the child's typical vocabulary level.
Provide context clues or explanations to make meanings clear.
Repeat new words 2-3 times throughout the story for reinforcement.
Prefer vivid, descriptive words that enhance imagery and emotional understanding.

storyStructure.template:
Story Structure Requirements:
- Start with "Title: [Your Story Title]" on the first line
- Follow with the story content
- Divide the story into clear, logical segments that represent pages
- IMPORTANT: Insert "---" (three hyphens) on a separate line between segments to indicate page breaks
- Each page should be 2-3 paragraphs in length and flow naturally
- Include page breaks at natural points where illustrations could enhance the story
- Aim for 3-6 pages total, depending on the requested story length
- End with a clear resolution that reinforces the story's theme

formatGuidelines.template:
Format Requirements:
- Use clear paragraph breaks
- Keep paragraphs concise (2-4 sentences)
- Include dialogue when appropriate
- Use descriptive language that creates vivid mental images
- Maintain consistent tense throughout
- VERY IMPORTANT: Use "---" (three hyphens) on a separate line to indicate where a new page should begin
- Make sure each page (separated by "---") has a coherent chunk of the story

interactive.template:
Interactive Elements:
- Include {promptCount} moments where the reader is prompted to participate
- Examples: "Can you spot the [object]?", "What do you think happens next?", "Try making the sound a [animal] makes!"
- Place interactive prompts at natural points in the narrative
- Design prompts to reinforce the story's theme or moral
- Ensure prompts are appropriate for the target age group

variability.template:
Variability Requirements:
- Make this story unique, creative, and different from other stories you've generated
- Avoid formulaic storytelling - surprise the reader with unexpected twists
- Create fresh characters and scenarios that stand out
- Use this unique seed to ensure variability: {seed}
